intro: Anthemis chamomilla, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, gray-green leaves. Its essential oil, extracted from the flowers, contains compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene, which are responsible for its therapeutic properties. Anthemis chamomilla is widely cultivated for use in herbal medicine and as a calming tea.
